intro: Taraxacum polatschekii, commonly known as the Polatschek's dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring a rosette of basal leaves that are hairy and lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets, which develop into fluffy seeds with pappus for wind dispersal. This species is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
